definitions.text: an upward movement (especially a rhythmical rising and falling)
examples: the heaving of waves on a rough sea

definitions.text: the act of lifting something with great effort
an involuntary spasm of ineffectual vomiting
examples: a bad case of the heaves
he responded with a lift of his eyebrow
fireman learn several different raises for getting ladders up
he gave it a mighty heave
he was not good at heaving passes

definitions.text: utter a sound, as with obvious effort
examples: She heaved a deep sigh when she saw the list of things to do

definitions.text: rise and move, as in waves or billows
move or cause to move in a specified way, direction, or position
breathe noisily, as when one is exhausted
examples: The runners reached the finish line, panting heavily

definitions.text: bend out of shape, as under pressure or from heat
examples: The highway buckled during the heat wave

definitions.text: make an unsuccessful effort to vomit; strain to vomit
